About

I’m a first-year Ph.D. student in the CILVR lab at NYU Courant, co-advised by Rob Fergus and Lerrel Pinto. My research interests include representation learning, differentiable computing, intuitive physics, and reinforcement learning. I’m fortunate to be supported by a 2021-2022 Deepmind Ph.D. fellowship.

Previously, I majored in math at MIT. During my undergrad, I did research on the cognitive bases of physical strategy learning in humans with the MIT Computational Cognitive Science Group, advised by Kelsey R. Allen and Josh Tenenbaum, and on neural partial differential equations for accelerating climate models with the Climate Modeling Alliance, advised by Andre N. Souza and Raffaele Ferrari. I also spent wonderful summers as a SV SRP student in Wulfram Gerstner’s group at EPFL and as a Ph.D. research intern in Michael P. Brenner’s group at Google Research.
